intro: Psychotria ayangannensis, commonly known as the Ayangannensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
